name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: Oh great, another fresh face in the village. Just what I needed. I'm Haus, the blacksmith. If you need armor or weapon upgrades, I'm your guy—assuming you can afford it. But don't expect any pleasantries. Got it?

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: Yeah, I heard you the first time. Welcome to Telmaron. Just keep your hands off my tools and we'll get along just fine. If you're lookin' for gear that's worth its weight, step right up. Otherwise, don't waste my time. Got it?

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: Third time's the charm, huh? Welcome to Telmaron, I reckon. If you need something forged or fixed, talk to me—Haus, your less-than-friendly blacksmith. Just don't expect any warm welcomes. Now, are you lookin' to do business, or are you just here to repeat yourself?

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: Well, aren't you consistent. Welcome to Telmaron, for the fourth time. I'm Haus, as I've said. If you're here to get some gear in shape or done right, I'm your go-to. Otherwise, I've got work to do, so say your piece or move along.

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: Clearly not too new if you're back again, eh? I reckon you've got that village welcome memorized by now. As I've said before, I'm Haus, the blacksmith. Need armor or weapon work? Let me know. Otherwise, let's not dance in circles, yeah?

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: Well, well, well, back for more greetings, are we? Either you’ve got a knack for consistency or you really like hearing me talk. Haus, blacksmith. You know the drill. Now, unless you've got business, I'm going back to hammering steel.

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: You've got persistence, I'll give you that. Welcome to Telmaron, yet again. Haus here, and I've got the same offer as before—armor and weapon work, if you need it. Otherwise, I'm still busy, and you're still here. What's it gonna be?

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: This is turning into a broken record. Welcome to Telmaron, over and over again. I’m Haus, your ever-cranky blacksmith. Now, if you’re here to actually talk shop, we might get somewhere. Spare me the reruns, and we'll get along just fine.

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: All right, this is getting old, even for me. Welcome—again—to Telmaron. Haus is the name, blacksmithing's my game. If you're here for armor or weapons, speak up. Otherwise, I've got things to forge that don't involve endless pleasantries.

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: Alright, alright, I get it. You're new. Welcome to Telmaron for the tenth time. Got that welcome etched in steel now. If you need something forged, let's talk. Otherwise, I'd appreciate a break from this one-man echo chamber.

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: Finally, a bit of variety. What kind of tools are you after? Weapons, armor, or something else? Be specific, so I can see if I’ve got what you need or if I’ll have to forge it from scratch. Mind you, quality work comes at a price.

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: Looks like we're back to square one. If you're looking for tools, you'll have to tell me exactly what you need. Weapons? Armor? Something else? I might have it on hand, or I might need to fire up the forge. Either way, it'll cost you.

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: You've got a knack for repeating yourself. Still need tools, huh? I've got plenty around, but you'll have to be more specific. Tell me what you need, and I'll see if it's available or if I need to make it. Prices are non-negotiable, by the way.

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: And we're back at it. Tools you need, tools I got, provided you can narrow down what you're after. Be precise—weaponry, armor, something else entirely? Name it, and let's see if I can help you out of this loop. Just remember, quality doesn't come cheap.

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: I guess there's comfort in repetition. So, you need tools. I'm not a mind reader, though. Be specific—what kind of tools are you after? Weapons, armor, or something entirely different? Give me details, and then we can talk shop. Prices are firm, mind you.

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: Alright, I get it—you’re consistent. So let's try this again: what tools do you need? Be clear. Weapons? Armor? Something else? Unless I know, I can't help you. And don’t forget, good craftsmanship ain't free.

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: You again? Seems like you love hearing my greetings as much as I love repeating them. Haus here, your cranky blacksmith. If you're looking to do some business—like upgrading gear—then we can talk. Otherwise, I'm swapping "welcomes" for my hammer and anvil.

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: I think I’ve got déjà vu. Welcome to Telmaron, once more. You've met Haus, the blacksmith, enough times by now. If you have work for me, say the word and we’ll get to it. Otherwise, I've got a lot of metal that won't forge itself.

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: Well, who would've guessed? You're new in town. Welcome, once again, to Telmaron. Name's Haus, your trusty blacksmith. Ready to actually talk business? If not, I'll get back to my forge.

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: I think we've established that already, haven't we? Welcome to Telmaron, all over again. I'm Haus, the blacksmith. Ready to dive into some business, or are we doing this dance all day?

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: And the record spins again. Welcome to Telmaron, yet another time. I'm Haus. If you're finally ready to move past introductions and talk shop, let me know. Otherwise, I've got plenty of iron that needs attention.

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: You really do like introductions, don't you? Welcome to Telmaron, again. I'm Haus, your perpetually cranky blacksmith. If you've got business to discuss, let's get on with it. Otherwise, I'll be here, wrestling with my forge.

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: No kidding. Welcome to Telmaron—for what feels like the hundredth time. I'm Haus, your resident blacksmith. If you're looking to actually accomplish something, let me know. Otherwise, I'm gonna let my hammer do the talking.

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: You've certainly mastered the art of introductions! Welcome to Telmaron, once again. I'm Haus, though you likely know that by now. Care to finally get down to business, or are we still just exchanging pleasantries?

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: You're persistent, I'll give you that. Welcome to good old Telmaron, one more time. I'm Haus, your less-than-chipper blacksmith. Let's talk business if you've got any, or I'll be busy with my forge.

name: Haus, the blacksmith
text: At this point, I think even the anvil knows you’re new in town. Welcome—again—to Telmaron. I’m Haus, the blacksmith. Ready to talk shop, or is this just a social call?
